Cutler House.review: Absolutely loved the vintage vibe of this place.
The rooms are cozy but can get a bit noisy during weekends.

Hitchcock House.review: Feels like a close-knit community. Everyone is super friendly.
I wish the WiFi was a bit stronger on the top floors.

Pierce House.review: The common areas are always clean and it's a great place to socialize.
A bit away from the main campus, but the peaceful surroundings make up for it.

Storrs House.review: Storrs has a unique charm. It feels like a second home.
The only downside is the laundry room which gets crowded at times.

Clarke Tower.review: The view from the higher floors is simply breathtaking.
Elevators can be slow during peak hours, but overall a great living space.

Norton House.review: I love the close proximity to campus eateries. So convenient!
Rooms are spacious and well-lit. A great choice for first-year students.

Raymond House.review: The garden area is my favorite spot to relax and study.
The community here is vibrant. Always something happening!

Sherman House.review: Modern amenities and super comfortable living spaces.
The wifi can be patchy on certain floors. But overall, a solid choice.

Smith House.review: The proximity to the library is a huge plus for night owls.
Shared spaces can get crowded, especially during exams. Plan accordingly!

Taft House.review: It feels more like a cozy home than a dorm. Absolutely love it.
I wish the gym was a bit closer. But the ambiance more than compensates.

Taplin House.review: The rooftop area is great for evening hangouts. Loved my time here.
The study rooms are well-maintained. Helps during crunch time.

Tyler House.review: A quiet environment that's perfect for focusing on academics.
It's a bit further from the main eateries, so plan your meals accordingly.

Alumni House.review: Feels rich in history and traditions. A sense of pride living here.
The wooden interiors give it a classic touch. Though, it can get a bit creaky.

Howe House.review: Bright and spacious rooms with modern amenities. Feels very comfortable.
The communal kitchen is a great place to bond with fellow residents.

Staley House.review: The architecture is unique, giving a blend of classic and modern feels.
The garden area is peaceful, perfect for evening reads.

Tippit House.review: The facilities are top-notch. The game room is always lively!
Located close to many campus activities. Makes life a lot easier.

Glaser House.review: The minimalist design of the rooms is so refreshing. Love the aesthetics.
It's close to the main academic blocks, saving a lot of travel time.

Kusch House.review: The community vibe here is strong. Made some lifelong friends.
The walls can be a bit thin, so sometimes you can hear neighbors. But overall, a great experience.

Michelson House.review: The green spaces around the house make it feel serene and peaceful.
Rooms are well-maintained and the management is always prompt in addressing concerns.

Triangle Tower 2.review: Living in a tower has its perks! The view from the top floors is unbeatable.
Has a modern touch to it, but the elevators can be a tad slow during rush hours.

1609 Hazel Apartments.review: Modern interiors and friendly neighbors. It feels like home.
Close to many city attractions. However, parking can sometimes be a challenge.

1680 Apartment Building.review: The rooftop pool is a big plus, especially during summer.
I appreciate the 24/7 security. It gives a sense of safety.

1716 Apartments.review: Love the open floor plans. The natural light that pours in is amazing.
Conveniently located close to grocery stores and cafes.

1719 Apartment Building.review: The gym and recreational area are top-notch.
The community events hosted here are always fun and engaging.

1727 Apartment Building.review: The design is a mix of vintage and modern. Love the atmosphere.
Proximity to parks is great for evening walks.

Stephanie Tubbs Jones Residence Hall.review: Living here is a treat. Management is responsive and always ready to help.
It's lively and bustling with activity, great for extroverts.

The Monroe Apartments.review: The views from the higher floors are breathtaking.
Well-maintained amenities, and the fitness center is a bonus.

The Noble Apartment Building.review: A sense of community is palpable here. Residents are friendly and supportive.
Sometimes there's street noise, but the prime location makes up for it.

The Village House 1.review: Feels like a home away from home. Rooms are spacious.
Perfect for students looking for a quiet study environment.

The Village House 2.review: Has a contemporary design and the common areas are kept clean.
The proximity to the library is a huge plus for late-night study sessions.

The Village House 3.review: The green spaces surrounding the house are perfect for relaxation.
Management is proactive and organizes regular community events.

The Village House 3A.review: The architecture has a modern touch, making it quite appealing.
Great place for students, but sometimes can be a bit noisy on weekends.

The Village House 4.review: The balcony views are serene. A great place to enjoy evening tea.
Has a tight-knit community feel. I've made some lifelong friends here.

The Village House 5.review: Well-maintained common areas and responsive maintenance staff.
Close to academic blocks, making it easy to reach classes on time.

The Village House 6.review: The gardens are beautifully landscaped and are a delight to walk through.
While the interiors are modern, they maintain a touch of warmth and coziness.

The Village House 7.review: Has a community-focused design. There's a sense of belonging here.
Proximity to the campus cafe is great for quick snacks.

The Village at 115 Complex.review: It's like a mini-city in itself. Has everything you'd need within walking distance.
The amenities are top-notch, from gyms to study rooms. A complete package.

Triangle Towers.review: Living in the heart of the city, Triangle Towers offers a unique blend of urban living and peace.
The rooftop garden is a hidden gem, offering an oasis of calm amidst the bustling city.

Twin Gables Apartment Building.review: Impressed with the maintenance team. Any issue gets resolved quickly.
The parking situation could be better. But interiors are top-notch.
